SINCE 1960, HEATHCOTE HAS BEEN THE SOURCE OF EDUCATION, ACTIVITIES AND GENEROUS DONATIONS.
Heathcote was beautiful and amazing! Walking through it was like being in an oasis. I would highly recommend this to anyone who loves flowers. –
Todd F. from Heathcote’s TripAdvisor page.
Heathcote Botanical Gardens
consists of an assortment of specialty gardens including a
Japanese Garden, Reflection Garden, Herb Garden, Rainforest Display, Native Plants Garden, Secret Garden and a Palm & Cycad Walk
. These areas convey an atmosphere of individual garden rooms. Through this type of garden design, you will sense the intimacy of this unique botanical garden. Gracing the areas in between these specialty gardens are borders of flowering shrubs, bulbs, trees, vines and other assorted herbaceous plants. Niches found throughout the garden provide varied microclimates, which allows the use of a wide variety of plants ranging from those found in Mediterranean climates to the Tropics.
Heathcote Botanical Gardens is located on the southeast coast of Florida, in
USDA PLANT HARDINESS zone 10A
, and has both native Florida flora as well as exotic flora from around the world. It is uniquely situated in a biological transition zone between a warm-temperate zone to the north and a subtropical zone to the south. A transition zone contains species that are characteristic of the adjacent region to its north and south, as well as species that occur only in the transition zone. In the botanical world this is advantageous because it allows for greater diversity, which means that one may grow many kinds of plants from around the world that live under conditions associated with three climatic zones.
Virtual Tour
Heathcote Shares a Rich History with the Treasure Coast
Our labeled, plant collections are both grouped in specific areas in the Garden and dispersed throughout the Garden. Other plants of interest that tend to capture many of our visitors’ eyes and spark numerous inquiries have also been labeled. Labeling helps the local Garden visitor determine what plants they have in their own Florida home landscapes or what plants they may want to add. Visitors from all over the US and the world find the information on the plant labels interesting and helpful.

Cost of Admission

$5 Ages 6 to 17 (Children Under 6 Free)
Dogs/Pets $1.00
Free for Heathcote Members, Veterans, and Retired & Active First Responders with I.D. (excluding special fundraisers)
Handicap Accessible – Wheelchairs Available
AHS Reciprocal Garden members: Free with suggested donation amount of your choosing.
Special Events: Admissions prices may vary for special events. Installations open to the public during garden hours may have additional fees.
Virtual Tour of the Gardens
Dogs are welcome at Heathcote! There is an admission fee for pets.
Pet Policy
*Please note during Garden Of Lights pets are not permitted.
Heathcote Botanical Gardens is a Pet-Friendly facility*. Well-behaved pets are welcome and should be always leashed and under complete control by the owner while on Heathcote property. Leashes must always allow owner complete control over their pets. For the safety of your pet and the comfort of all our guests, retractable leashes must be locked at a maximum length of 4 feet while on property. Unlocked or extended retractable leashes are not permitted. This policy helps ensure a safe and enjoyable environment for everyone. Guests who do not comply with our pet guidelines may be asked to leave the premises. Owners are responsible for cleaning up after their pets and for any damage caused by their pets. Owners need to ensure pets are up to date on their vaccines. If pets show signs of aggression (growling, barking, snapping or other aggressive behaviors that may not be listed) you and your pet may be asked to leave the gardens. No refunds will be issued if you and your pet are asked to leave. Welcome and thanks for being a responsible pet owner!
There is a $1.00 admission fee per pet
. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.
OUR HISTORY
A plant nursery on Heathcote Street in Scarsdale, New York, was the earliest seed of what has grown and blossomed into Heathcote Botanical Gardens.
Like many New Yorkers, the business was transplanted to Florida. In 1960 owners Jim and Mollie Crimmins moved the business from its original Florida location on west Orange Avenue to its current Fort Pierce site on Savannah Road.
Then in 1967 the Crimmins moved their family home from Delaware Avenue to the nursery site. Now known as Heathcote House, the Crimmins’ home was built around 1922.
Today the Frame Vernacular Style structure sits graciously amid old live oaks. Its second floor balcony, Dade County pine floors, and quaint fireplace all add to its charm. It presently houses administrative offices. In 2001 the City Commission passed a resolution to designate it as a Historically Significant Site based on its architectural characteristics and ties to the life of the community.
At the heart of Heathcote is its historical house, now serving as administrative offices.
Jan Bals, Laura Baker, Gloria Moore, Norma Axx, Peggy Berg
When the Crimmins retired, they put the property up for sale. A group of concerned citizens led by Gloria Moore, Chris Haynes, Jan Bals, Norma Carsens, Laura Baker, Gloria Rooks and Peggy Berg saw the unique beauty of the spot and worked hard to preserve it as a public botanical garden. Heathcote Botanical Gardens, Inc., was incorporated in 1985 as a non-profit; and in 1986 the property was purchased with private donations raised by Heathcote Botanical Gardens, Inc., and grants from the state, county, and city. We are fortunate to be able to share some life history of Carol Herzog who spent part of her childhood growing up in the Heathcote House. To read more about her :
HerzogFullDocument
.
Today the non-profit continues to maintain and operate the Gardens and carry forward its mission.
Member Benefits
Memberships start at just $45 per year and Heathcote members enjoy a variety of benefits…
LEARN MORE ABOUT MEMBERSHIP
MAP OF EXHIBITS
Download and print our high-resolution Printable Map.
GIFT SHOP
For a unique shopping experience visit Heathcote Botanical Gardens’ Gift Shop! Anyone may shop the garden gift shop regardless of garden admission. The Gift Shop is the first building you will come to when entering the Gardens and the last building when exiting the Gardens. This is also where you will pay your admission fee to the Gardens and receive the self-guided tour map, along with a Garden brochure.
All Gardens Members receive a 10% discount on all Gift Shop purchases. (Some exclusions may apply)
The Gift Shop is open 10 am-4 pm during operational hours and some special events
Some merchandise you will find in the Garden Gift Shop includes:
Children’s nature-related games, shirts, books, toys and trinkets
Botanical t-shirts
Locally hand-crafted jewelry
Brilliantly-glazed pottery
Florida gardening and plant books
Local artists’ prints
Easy-to-use gardening tools, special sunscreen and waterproof gloves
Unusual greeting cards and note cards
Natural soaps
Decorative garden ornaments.
TOURS
Yes! I want to reserve a Guided Group Tour!
You can experience Heathcote by using our self-guided tour map, which you will receive at admissions, or you can make arrangements for a guided group tour by scheduling at least two weeks in advance of your visit.
Guided Tours are conducted Tuesday-Friday throughout the year.
There must be at least 6 people in a group for a guided group tour to be scheduled.
Cost for a guided group tour is $15.00/adults; Children 6-12 is $8.00. We do offer large group (20 and over)  discounts with advanced booking.
EMAIL HEATHCOTE
or call
772-464-4672
Garden Tours
Heathcote Co-Hort Nan Billings giving a tour for some residents from the Port St. Lucie Nursing Home and Restorative Care Center.

Your generous donation helps Heathcote fulfill its mission to provide cultural, educational and recreational activities to visitors of all ages and cultures, from varying geographical areas.Heathcote Botanical Gardens is a 501 (c) (3) non-profit organization.
The gardens operate with income generated from admissions, events and programs, memberships, gift shop revenue, facility rentals and private donations. Your donation is tax deductible to the fullest extent of the law.
Donate Today
Become a Member
Membership has its privileges:
Free or reduced cost admission to 350 gardens and museums, free classes and events, Gift Shop discounts, and the knowledge that YOU are supporting the home of the largest permanent public display of tropical bonsai collection in the U.S.!
There are many privileges associated with being a Gardens member (see Membership Categories & Privileges listed below), Please know that you are playing a vital role in keeping this valuable, educational facility growing and is the most encouraging reason to join and renew.
AHS Reciprocal Admissions Information HERE
Your membership is valid for one full year.
Purchase your membership online now!
Memberships to be mailed after purchase online. May take up to 2 weeks depending on mail delivery and processing.

501(C)(3)
Heathcote Botanical Gardens, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization and a self-supporting membership organization. Membership fees provide a substantial part of the income that keeps the Garden alive and growing. The Garden relies on various sources of income, but at this time, Membership fees produce almost one-third of the Garden’s income.
Member Benefits
Memberships start at just $45 per year and Heathcote members enjoy a variety of benefits…
LEARN MORE ABOUT MEMBERSHIP
BUSINESS MEMBERSHIP
HELP US PROTECT & EDUCATE OUR COMMUNITIES
Yes! My company is interested in Business Membership!
If your business wants to contribute to the development of our community as a place people thrive and prosper, join a select group of committed donors who, through corporate memberships, help:
Maintain and growing our gardens
Preserve our environment
Enhance the economy of our community
Expanding educational opportunities for children and adults
Create a regional cultural destination
Heathcote’s mission is to educate and inspire by providing a place of botanical beauty, and to serve as a resource for the conservation of our environment.
Business memberships begin at $1000 and include the benefits outlined below.
Business Membership Packages
All business membership packages include these five basic advantages
Listing on Heathcote’s website with link to your company’s website
Recognition in Heathcote’s newsletters
Free or reduced admission to reciprocating AHS gardens for Family Membership designees
Knowledge that you are supporting the Green Heart of the Treasure Coast.
Free use of Gardens for a private function once per year (venue only, restrictions apply)
Business Partner – $1000
Five basic advantages plus
Two (2) annual Family Memberships to designate as you wish
Ten (10) guest admission passes
Private tour of Garden for up to ten (10)

Four (4) annual Family Memberships to designate as you wish
Twenty (20) guest admission passes
Private tour of Garden for up to twenty (20)
Business Leader – $3000
Five basic advantages plus
Six (6) annual Family Memberships to designate as you wish
Thirty (30) guest admission passes
Private tour of Garden for up to thirty (30)
For the Benefits of Corporate Memberships at levels exceeding $3000, please contact Heathcote Botanical Gardens . By Phone: office : 772-464-4672 or email us at
info@heathcotebg.org.
EMAIL US FOR MORE INFORMATION
ROYAL PALM SOCIETY
EDUCATE, PROTECT, AND PRESERVE FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS
Please join an elite group of supporters who help develop our community through charitable contributions to the Royal Palm Society.
The Royal Palm Society is a select group of philanthropic leaders committed to the environmental, cultural, educational and recreational mission* of Heathcote Botanical Gardens.
Royal Palm Society donations:
Maintain and grow our gardens
Preserve our environment
Enhance the economy of our community
Expand educational opportunities for children and adults
Create a regional cultural destination
*Heathcote’s mission is to educate and inspire by providing a place of botanical beauty, and to serve as a resource for conservation of our environment.
Giving Levels
Order of the Queen Palm ($10,000 and higher)
Order of the King Palm ($5,000 – $ 9,999)
Order of the Majesty Palm – Corporate ($3,000 – $ 4,999)
Order of the Silver Palm – Individual ($1,000 – $2,999)

Volunteer Work Days
Everyone is invited to participate regardless of experience. You must be over the age of 16 to volunteer on your own. Anyone under the age of 16 must always be supervised by a responsible adult over the age of 21.
Why Volunteer?
To meet and connect with new and interesting people of all ages
To give back to your community
To become more active, productive and/or sociable
To add a new sense of purpose to your life
To share your skills and knowledge
To become a valuable part of a worthwhile, educational facility
To participate in a meaningful endeavor – the growth of your botanical garden
Heathcote Botanical Gardens is what it is today due to the work of numerous, dedicated volunteers. Today, even with a growing staff, volunteers still play a vital role at the Gardens and are needed daily.
There are a variety of Volunteer Opportunities you can choose from depending on your availability, physical capabilities, skills and desired level of involvement.
Volunteer today. We have a schedule and level of participation that is just right for you. Call the Gardens’ Office at 772-464-4672  for a current list of volunteer opportunities.
Submit your volunteer form by emailing
tscarpignato@heathcotebg.org
Volunteer Opportunities
Gardening Volunteers
Like to garden? Assist the gardener with weeding, watering, fertilizing, propagating & other tasks. No experience needed.
Events Volunteers
Want to volunteer but don’t have a lot of time? There are many jobs for volunteers during special events throughout the year too!
Children’s Docents
Trained docents have an opportunity to share their knowledge with visitors through educational programs and informal contacts. Work is mainly outdoors or in the Pioneer House or the Bonsai Pavilion.
Gift Shop Volunteers
Like the garden but prefer the air conditioning? Assist with gift shop sales, collect admissions, greet visitors & more!
Office Volunteers
Do you have office skills to share? Help with mailings, filing, answering phones, light data entry & more! No experience needed
Garden Ambassador
Spread the word about Heathcote. Recruit new volunteers, lead a tour, staff a table at a community event, speak to a group & more!
Committee Member
Share your expertise and serve on one of our committees – Events, Membership, Fundraising & more!
GARDEN OF LIGHTS VOLUNTEERS
Garden of Lights Sign up and Job Descriptions
Sign up to volunteer at Heathcote’s Gardens of Lights. Choose the button for the date you want to volunteer and it will take you directly to our online sign up. Then select the job you would prefer to do. Want to join us for more than one night? Of course you do because it’s so much fun! Just select another date after signing up for your first evening of volunteering and add yourself to the additional day(s). We can’t wait to welcome you here for the fun! Sharing the Garden of Lights experience with others through volunteering is a great way to spend an evening or two over the holidays.
Our Garden of Lights event typically runs from late November to the end of December.
Click here to go to sign up page.
For more information email:
volunteer@heathcotebg.org
Or call:
772-464-4672
Brief descriptions of many of the volunteer opportunities for Garden of Lights:
Admissions & Counters
Responsible for collecting cash or credit card admission fees at the two entrance gates to the event. Must be comfortable handling money, making change and processing credit card sales. Since Heathcote has transitioned to optional online tickets sales many admissions will just require verification of digital ticket.
Docent
Keep guests on the path and out of the lights and water, facilitate movement throughout the garden, answer questions and manage props in their area.
Gift Shop
Volunteers will be at the cash register to check out guests’ purchases or will be floating through the gift shop and assisting guests with purchases. Must be comfortable handling money and credit card transactions. Requires standing, walking and knowledge of gift shop procedures. Training is provided throughout the year and while volunteering.
Heathcote Bear
The Heathcote Bear is an opportunity for guests to take “selfie” photos. Be available to take guests’ photographs with their equipment if requested. Keep guests in an orderly line near the Bear as warranted by traffic volume. Must be comfortable using cameras and cell phones. Requires standing.
Parking
Volunteers will direct cars to appropriate parking areas and direct guests to the entrance of the event. Requires standing and walking. (Sketch of appropriate parking will be available.)
Floaters
Assist wherever needed such as filling in for no shows, relief of others for a break, etc. Standing and moving around is required.
Garden Ambassadors
Provide information for memberships, volunteers, classes, upcoming events, raffles etc.
Volunteer Sign in/Hospitality
Assist with volunteer sign-in and guide volunteers to their designated areas. Relieve volunteers and vendors for short breaks. Not responsible for taking money in vendor booths.

501(C)(3)
Heathcote Botanical Gardens, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization and a self-supporting membership organization. Membership fees provide a substantial part of the income that keeps the Garden alive and growing. The Garden relies on various sources of income, but at this time, Membership fees produce almost one-third of the Garden’s income.
Member Benefits

UPCOMING EVENTS
EVENTS CALENDAR
Upcoming Events
Music in the Gardens: Every Thursday approximately 12 pm – 1 pm until Mid May then restarts in the Fall
Looking for a wonderful way to decompress. Come by Heathcote Botanical Gardens on Thursdays between 12-1pm and enjoy Bob Lusk performing meditative  style music. An hour to wander among the Gardens while enjoying the wonderful background ambiance. It is a combination certain to please. Free with admission to garden. Occurs most Thursdays.
Family Fun Day May 10th:
FREE family day at Heathcote with lawn games, sidewalk chalk until spots are filled and food truck,
Killer Chefs on Wheels.
Bonsai classes: Sign up
today for one of our upcoming Bonsai classes. We have at least one per quarter.  All classes offered this year can be found under our
store tab
. You can sign up now for which ever ones intrigue you.
Upcoming workshops:
We are offering a variety of workshops this year at Heathcote. May 17th you can join us for Balance in Nature: The Art of Stone Balancing.
Garden of Lights 2025. Dates and more information to come
This year our Garden of Lights kicks off  the first weekend of December and it’s every weekend: Friday, Saturday AND Sunday 5:30-9pm.
Garden of Light
s
visitors will enjoy enchanted gardens that feature favorite light displays from last year, as well as new additions to dazzle audiences. This year our illuminators already have some new exciting changes for 2025!    The Gardens is transformed into an oasis of wonder for a spectacular light event. Be sure to add this to your must see over the winter holidays! Reminder pets are not permitted for this event. Interested in joining our Illumination team?
Email
us and we will get you connected. No previous skills or experience needed!
Recurring Events
Bonsai Collection Tour:
Occurs when the curator is onsite,
2:00 pm – 4:00 pm
Tour the
James J. Smith Bonsai Collection
,
meet the curator and hear the history of the collection. *November-May. Call for more information or to schedule your groups private tour. Minimum group of 10 required to book a private tour.
Bonsai Clinic with the Bonsai Curator:
Call for current days available
3:00 pm – 4:00 pm
Sharpen your skills and learn how to care for your Bonsai. Bring your questions and thirst for knowledge.
Advance registration required at least 2 weeks prior to the date: Members $10, $15 for Non-Members. Call us to enroll 772-464=4672 #3
A walk in the Garden:
every 3rd Thursday of each month,
11:00 am
Heathcote’s Horticulturist or docent share highlights of the
plant galleries
of Heathcote.
Garden Admission (free to members). *November–May.
Want to do art in the Garden?
Call us to arrange time for your group to come and surround yourself with the beauty of the garden to inspire your masterpieces. 772-464-4672 #3. Please note admission fee does apply but discounts are available for larger groups. You have the option to schedule this before regular garden hours on select days.
Propagators & Horticulture Helpers
Every Wednesday, play in the dirt and help maintain the Gardens for all to enjoy.
Bring your lunch and enjoy sharing your favorite gardening stories
with other nature enthusiasts who make a difference at Heathcote. Can’t make it on Wednesday? Volunteers are welcome any day of the week!
Volunteer Coffee – Volunteer Orientation
3rd Wednesday of each month at Heathcote House:
Volunteers sustain Heathcote to help maintain collections, growing plants,
Garden Gift Shop/Admissions & special events. Everyone makes a difference! Come by and learn about all the volunteer opportunities available and make some new friends!
To RSVP, call:
772-464-4672
